question: Which two countries share the course of the Curaray River?
explanation: Curaray River, also known as Ewenguno River, flows through Peru and Ecuador. This river rises from the Andes and joins Napo River as its tributary thereby becomes the part of Amazon River Basin. This river was the site of the Operation Auca of 1956 in which Huaorani tribespeople killed four Christain missionaries in their attempt to evangelise the Huaorani.
